pros: They are willing to work with me to ensure the schedule and compensation matches my needs
cons: DMG has partnered with Valleywise to provide care. Physicians often don't get alot of agency when it comes to their team such as MAs. nursing etc.

pros: Flexible schedule, dedicated coworkers, benefits

job_title: Mental Health Professional in La Crosse, WI
pros: Good salary overall, good benefits
cons: Not many, overall vision lacking at times

pros: The work was interesting, it was nice to learn many different areas of medicine.
cons: The environment fostered was volatile and hostile. The turn over was very high for the coders and the coding manager position. Directives were not clear and were explained with discrepancies to different to employees. The office was very unorganized with unrealistic expectations of completing the work load. Some coders were let go without hardly any reasoning while other coders remained in their positions after committing severe offenses. Management shared personnel information with some of the staff members that was inappropriate.

pros: excellent way to start medical career
cons: Management plays strong favoritism. As soon as you make a mistake and get on managements bad side, you are on a downward spiral with no chance to redeem or correct your mistake. Management will try every corporate tactic and ploy to get you fired or quit. This includes lying, isolating employees with no witnesses for physical and mental abuse and making employees feel like they are not human. The medical staff and temp staff are treated fairly but there is no respect for them either. Favorites will be regarded highly and be careful in angering them as well.

review_title: Many Opportunities for growth  at DMG
pros: I feel supported in my long-term career goals at DMG. The work is challenging and exciting; there's something new to tackle every single day. The benefits are good and there are several employee perks to take advantage of.
cons: The corporate office isn't in the best part of the city. Also there's the typical office gossip and administrative turnover that can hinder reaching departmental and company goals. I also wish the salaries were a bit more competitive in today's job market. But all-in-all, it's a great place to work!

pros: Work with a wide verity of technology
cons: Everything - extremely poor IT management. CIO has no idea how to lead his team and is destroying the department from the inside out. The environment is crumbling, anyone with insight into how the environment is setup has either been fired or quit due to unrealistic goals, timelines or poor management decisions blamed on employees. IT management has very very little real IT experience and do not understand basic terminology. Project Management is non existent, change control is a joke, no documentation, environment is crumbling. STAY FAR AWAY!!!

pros: Great benefits. I cannot add any other pros since there are none
cons: All the management there lies. All the people fear for their jobs and will back stab each other to get to the top. They will lie to their customers and even other associations to get grants or money. They say they are non-profit BUT they act like a corporation. Making money is the bottom line for them and if something isn't making money then it won't be accepted into the company. Being non-profit in itself is a lie

pros: Education is big plus and offered as well as employee wellness
cons: Supervisor and  Managers are not able to understand   complex situations  wasting time in finding the answers when if employees could speak to one another and solve the issues it would be done in minutes not weeks

pros: Mostly stayed out of the way of operations at the hospital level. Let me do my work with very little bother.
cons: They were slow to complete my hiring paperwork (worked job for 3 weeks before they called me in), required drug test (but I never did it and they never said anything....sloppy), required HIPAA training (never did it and they never said anything...sloppy x2).

pros: Family oriented, kind, generous and thoughtful are the first things that come to mind. Great growth potential.
cons: Not sure what to say here. Everyone everywhere has flaws. If you have true intentions on working and doing a good job, the cons are nearly nothing.

review_title: Diverse workplace good pay but lacking in caring
pros:
opportunity to move up
benefits
diversity in workplace
company on the rise
operates many clinics, has wide network of partners
cons:
not an employee-friendly or family-friendly place
negative work atmosphere
lack of caring for patients, employees - only bottom line matters
lacking in integrity (i.e. lies, deceptive practices)
No choice for health benefits - only offer UnitedHealthCare plans

pros: Good benefits including many paid holidays, diverse workplace, family atmosphere, opportunities for advancement, employee activities, good break room with free soda, coffee and tea
cons: Salaries are below market averages, a lot of gossiping and office politics even at the leadership level, HR department lacks employee privacy

pros: Excellent, family friendly company.  Management strives to help you meet goals for yourself both professionally and personally. Always a friendly atmosphere.
cons: Understaffing makes for increased workloads.  While people are helpful, the nature of the business is such that life can be frenetic.  Especially as you can be doing the work of 2-3 people.

pros: Opportunity for student loan repayment. Management is completely disconnected so you are very independent. You have the ability to help disadvantaged people.
cons: Nonsupportive management, management is reactive versus proactive. Lack of resources/preceptor for new staff. Inability to manage own schedule and inability to choose your own support staff to work with, which can make for a hostile/negative work environment.
